author: Fausty

text: Ridley was the one responsible for attacking Samus' planet when she was a child.  He killed everyone, including her parents.  Samus was the only survivor. Rescued by the Chozo.  Ridley is Samus' arch nemesis.  On top of that, no matter how many times she kills him, he keeps coming back.  If that doesnt trigger some traumatic stress, I dont know what will.
author: Tryck Spot

text: What I hated was especially the scene where Ridley is encountered. Why the hell would that trigger PTSD in Samus? In every other game where she encounters him, she beats him like a badass.
author: Andy Smith

text: This game was really awesome, but I didn't have that "lone wolf" feeling that I get from the other Metroid games. It was cool that they added a greater storyline, but I liked the quiet Samus who had no help at all

author: MrKeyblademaster1992

text: @notabear1 I guess the voice acting thing is more opinion, but that is way closer to fact that they should have kept it in more of a Super Emtroid, or at least Fusion style.  I don't like when any game gives you too much guidance on where to go or what to do.  Prime only gave you vague hints which you could turn off.
author: Mr.Ridley

text: @notabear1 Ok, well I don't read any mangas so I guess i'm not a hardcore fan then.  I also didn't like how the game is way too linear.  What made Super and Prime so great was that you could do the whole game at what ever % and pace you want.
author: Mr.Ridley

text: @notabear1 But how has this been her for a decade?  This wasn't her in any of the Prime games or Fusion.  I don't mind her shoing more character, but the way she cried and talked in dsome typical princess girl voice was so annoying.
author: Mr.Ridley

text: @notabear1 So you're saying one game compared to every other one in the series is supposed to just completely change what we've seen as her personality?  If you're a true fan and have most or a lot of the series, then you would be used to her being this baddass bounty hunter that us get's the job done and leaves the planet.  I'm normally really opened minded ingeneral, but I just don't like completely retconing a character, especially one as big as Samus.
author: Mr.Ridley

text: @notabear1 So you're not a real fan of the series if you didn't like the style of Other M.  How was it always her character, I don't remember her crying before the Ridley fight in Super or Prime.
author: Mr.Ridley

author: j-force

text:
Old fans hate the Prime games? That's not what I've heard, nor is it how I feel.

The Prime series is just as it should be. Retro managed to stick to the original formula and translate it quite well to 3D. Excluding Corruption, the sense of exploration and solitude is very much intact in the Prime games.
